comments.body:
The error object on line 158 and 169 is same and can be stored in a variable instead:
```jason
{
  code: 'ERR_OUT_OF_RANGE',
  name: 'RangeError [ERR_OUT_OF_RANGE]',
  message: 'The value of "gid" is out of range. ' +
    'It must be >= 0 && < 4294967296. Received -1'
}
```

That's exactly what the call to `getHandle` is doing. These tests are passing when I run them locally. The CI failures seem related to linting. I'm new to contributing to node so it's entirely possible I'm missing something here.

@iansu oh hey! run `make lint` locally, this should help point you in the right direction:

https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/master/doc/guides/contributing/pull-requests.md#the-process-of-making-changes
@bcoe I've done that. I just pushed some formatting changes about 10 minutes before you commented. Formatting looks good now, at least locally.

Oh, looking on Travis it seems to be complaining about one of my commit messages.

Is `test` not a valid/correct subsystem to use here? What should it be?
No that's a bug in our commit message linting, you can ignore that.
